chapters.name: The Five Jewels of Gaṇeśa
chapters.summary: This chapter contains the five primary verses of salutation and praise to Lord Gaṇeśa, followed by the Phalaśruti, which describes the benefits of reciting this hymn.

verses.original: मुदा करात्तमोदकं सदा विमुक्तिसाधकम्। कलाधरावतंसकं विलासिलोकरक्षकम्। अनायकैकनायकं विनाशितेभदैत्यकम्। नताशुभाशुनाशकं नमामि तं विनायकम्॥
verses.transliteration: mudā karāttamodakaṁ sadā vimuktisādhakam। kalādharāvatansaṁ vilāsilokarakṣakam। anāyakaikanāyakaṁ vināśitebhadāityakam। natāśubhāśunāśakaṁ namāmi taṁ vināyakam॥
verses.translation: I salute that Vināyaka, who joyfully holds the Modaka (sweet) in his hand, who is always the bestower of salvation, whose head is adorned with the moon, who protects the joyous worlds, who is the sole Lord for the forlorn, who destroyed the elephant-demon (Gajāsura), and who quickly destroys the inauspiciousness of his devotees.

translations.english: I salute that Vināyaka, who joyfully holds the Modaka (sweet) in his hand, who is always the bestower of salvation, whose head is adorned with the moon, who protects the joyous worlds, who is the sole Lord for the forlorn, who destroyed the elephant-demon (Gajāsura), and who quickly destroys the inauspiciousness of his devotees.

verses.original: नतेतरातिभीकरं नवोदितार्कभास्वरम्। नमत्सुरारिनिर्जरं नताधिकापदुद्धरम्। सुरेश्वरं निधीश्वरं गजेश्वरं गणेश्वरम्। महेश्वरं तमाश्रये परात्परं निरन्तरम्॥
verses.transliteration: natetarātibhīkaraṁ navoditārkabhāsvaram। namatsurārinirjaraṁ natādhikāpaduddharam। sureśvaraṁ nidhīśvaraṁ gajeśvaraṁ gaṇeśvaram। maheśvaraṁ tamāśraye parātparaṁ nirantaram॥
verses.translation: I continuously take refuge in that Maheśvara (Gaṇeśa), who is terrifying to those who do not bow, who shines like the newly risen sun, who is saluted by the Devas and enemies of the Devas, who removes the great calamities of the devotees, who is the Lord of Devas, the Lord of treasures, the Lord of elephants (Gaṇeśa), the Lord of Gaṇas, and who is higher than the highest.

translations.english: I continuously take refuge in that Maheśvara (Gaṇeśa), who is terrifying to those who do not bow, who shines like the newly risen sun, who is saluted by the Devas and enemies of the Devas, who removes the great calamities of the devotees, who is the Lord of Devas, the Lord of treasures, the Lord of elephants (Gaṇeśa), the Lord of Gaṇas, and who is higher than the highest.

verses.original: समस्तलोकशङ्करं निरस्तदैत्यकुञ्जरम्। दरेतरोदरं वरं वरेभवक्त्रमक्षरम्। कृपाक॑रं क्षमाकरं मुदाकरं यशस्करम्। मनस्करं नमस्कृतां नमस्करोमि भास्वरम्॥
verses.transliteration: samastalokaśaṅkaraṁ nirastadaityakuñjaram। daretarodaraṁ varaṁ varebhavaktramakṣaram। kṛpākaraṁ kṣamākaraṁ mudākaraṁ yaśaskaram। manaskaraṁ namaskṛtāṁ namaskaromi bhāsvaram॥
verses.translation: I salute that shining Lord, who brings auspiciousness to all the worlds, who destroyed the elephant demon, who has a large and excellent belly, whose face is that of a noble elephant, who is imperishable, who is gracious, forgiving, joyful, fame-giving, and who grants good memory to those who bow to him.

translations.english: I salute that shining Lord, who brings auspiciousness to all the worlds, who destroyed the elephant demon, who has a large and excellent belly, whose face is that of a noble elephant, who is imperishable, who is gracious, forgiving, joyful, fame-giving, and who grants good memory to those who bow to him.

verses.original: अकिञ्चनार्तिमार्जनं चिरन्तनोक्तिभाजनम्। पुरारिपूर्वनन्दनं सुरारिगर्वचर्वणम्। प्रपञ्चनाशभीषणं धनञ्जयादिभूषणम्। कपोलदानवारणं भजे पुराणवारणम्॥
verses.transliteration: akiñcanārtimārjanaṁ cirantanoktibhājanam। purāripūrvānandanaṁ surārigarvacarvaṇam। prapañcanāśabhīṣaṇaṁ dhanañjayādibhūṣaṇam। kapoladānavāraṇaṁ bhaje purāṇavāraṇam॥
verses.translation: I worship that ancient Elephant-God, who cleanses the suffering of the destitute, who is the repository of ancient wisdom, who is the elder son of the destroyer of the Puras (Śiva), who crushes the pride of the enemies of the Devas, who is terrible at the time of the dissolution of the universe, who is adorned with snakes, and whose temples exude ichor (Mada).

translations.english: I worship that ancient Elephant-God, who cleanses the suffering of the destitute, who is the repository of ancient wisdom, who is the elder son of the destroyer of the Puras (Śiva), who crushes the pride of the enemies of the Devas, who is terrible at the time of the dissolution of the universe, who is adorned with snakes, and whose temples exude ichor (Mada).

verses.original: नितान्तकान्तदन्तकान्ति मन्तकान्तकात्मजम्। अचिन्त्यरूपमन्तहीनमन्तरायकृन्तनम्। हृदन्तरे निरन्तरं वसन्तमेव योगिनाम्। तमेकदन्तमेव तं विचिन्तयामि सन्ततम्॥
verses.transliteration: nitāntakāntadantakānti mantakāntakātmajam। acintyarūpamantahīnamantarāyakṛntanam। hṛdantare nirantaraṁ vasantameva yoginām। tamēkadantamēva taṁ vicintayāmi santatam॥
verses.translation: I always meditate on that very Ekadanta (single-tusked one), who has exceedingly beautiful teeth, who is the son of the destroyer of Yama (Śiva), whose form is inconceivable, who is endless, who cuts down obstacles, and who resides perpetually in the hearts of the yogis.

translations.english: I always meditate on that very Ekadanta (single-tusked one), who has exceedingly beautiful teeth, who is the son of the destroyer of Yama (Śiva), whose form is inconceivable, who is endless, who cuts down obstacles, and who resides perpetually in the hearts of the yogis.

verses.original: महागणेशपञ्चरत्नमादरेण योऽन्वहं। प्रजल्पति प्रभातके हृदि स्मरन् गणेश्वरम्। अरोगतामदोषतां सुसाहितीं सुपुत्रताम्। समाहितायुरष्टभूति मभ्युपैति सोऽचिरम्॥
verses.transliteration: mahāgaṇeśapañcaratnamādareṇa yo’nvahaṁ। prajalpati prabhātake hṛdi smaran gaṇeśvaram। ārogatāmadōṣatāṁ susāhitīṁ suputratām। samāhitāyuraṣṭabhūti mabhyupaiti so'ciram॥
verses.translation: (Phalaśruti) The person who recites these Five Gems of Mahāgaṇeśa daily with reverence at dawn, remembering Gaṇeśvara in their heart, quickly attains freedom from disease, freedom from defects, good company, worthy sons, long life, and the eight great spiritual powers (Aṣṭa Siddhis).

translations.english: (Phalaśruti) The person who recites these Five Gems of Mahāgaṇeśa daily with reverence at dawn, remembering Gaṇeśvara in their heart, quickly attains freedom from disease, freedom from defects, good company, worthy sons, long life, and the eight great spiritual powers (Aṣṭa Siddhis).
